title: How do teachers help a young child get used to attending school for the first time? - Quora

response.answer_text: I allowed the parent to stay as long as they wanted when I taught K. Some began to cry when they realized they were being left at school all alone. With me being 6′2″ many were taken back and being blonde, too, a big shock, then some looked at my bright blue eyes and wanted to touch them. My children were blacks and Mexicans so my presence was a rarity in Compton, CA. I also had stuffed animals and toys for the children to touch. It was so funny with some of them as they wanted to touch my hair and stand on my 13″ shoes, I was like a jungle gym to them. We had a fun year.

Meet them at the bus stop. Make sure there are plenty of table activities for when they come in, while everyone gets ready. Routine. Decorate the classroom. Be upbeat. Use Positive Behavior Reinforcement. (In French: Soutien au comportement positif) Create, a schedule and activities that captivate them. Etc.

That three letter word,- 'Fun'! If the present attending children, are enjoying themselves; ask them to invite the new child into the game; as long as it is simple, where even mistakes are laughed at! It's fun! Whee!
